TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit LongValidatorAttribute extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttribute
Public NotInheritable Class LongValidatorAttribute Inherits ConfigurationValidatorAttribute

Docs.summary: Declaratively instructs the .NET Framework to perform long-integer validation on a configuration property. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You use the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute> attribute to decorate a configuration property. This is to instruct the .NET Framework to validate the property using a <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidator> object and pass to it the value of the decorating parameters.
You can apply the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute> attribute to property types only.
## Examples The following example shows how to decorate the properties of a custom <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection> object using the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute> attribute.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes/CS/ConfigurationValidatorAttributes.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes/VB/ConfigurationValidatorAttributes.vb#7)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You use this constructor in the attributed model to ensure that the value assigned to the related property is a long integer.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ExcludeRange { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.ExcludeRange : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to include or exclude the integers in the range defined by the and property values.
Docs.value: true if the value must be excluded; otherwise, false. The default is false.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The range is inclusive of the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MinValue%2A> and <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MaxValue%2A> property values. When the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.ExcludeRange%2A> property value is `false`, the allowed values are outside the range.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.IntegerValidatorAttribute.ExcludeRange%2A> property.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes/CS/ConfigurationValidatorAttributes.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes/VB/ConfigurationValidatorAttributes.vb#7)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property long MaxValue { long get(); void set(long value); };
member this.MaxValue : int64 with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value allowed for the property.
Docs.value: A long integer that indicates the allowed maximum value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MaxValue%2A> property value is included in the allowed range.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MaxValue%2A> property.

remarks.format:

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ValidatorInstance As ConfigurationValidatorBase

Docs.summary: Gets an instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You use the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.ValidatorInstance%2A> property value to perform string validation by calling its <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidator.Validate%2A> method.
